table.name: application_histories
table.remarks: Change histories for accelerator applications. Only includes changes to top-level metadata, not things like changes to variable values.

table.name: application_module_statuses
table.remarks: (Enum) Possible statuses of individual modules in an application.

table.name: application_modules
table.remarks: Current states of the modules for individual applications.

table.name: application_statuses
table.remarks: (Enum) Possible statuses for an application to the accelerator program.

table.name: applications
table.remarks: Information about projects that are applying for the accelerator program.

table.name: cohort_modules
table.remarks: Which modules are assigned to which cohorts.

column.name: title
column.remarks: The title for the module for the cohort. For example "Module 3A" for Module 3A: Title

table.name: cohort_phases
table.remarks: (Enum) Available cohort phases

table.name: cohorts
table.remarks: Accelerator cohort details.

table.name: deal_stages
table.remarks: (Enum) Stages in the deal workflow that a project progresses through.

table.name: default_project_leads
table.remarks: Default project leads to use at application submission time based on project region.

table.name: default_voters
table.remarks: Users to automatically be assigned as voters on accelerator projects.

table.name: deliverable_categories
table.remarks: (Enum) High-level groups for organizing deliverables.

column.name: internal_interest_id
column.remarks: Internal interest enum that the deliverable category corresponds to.

table.name: deliverable_cohort_due_dates
table.remarks: Deliverable due dates overrides for cohorts. Can be overridden at the project level.

table.name: deliverable_documents
table.remarks: Information about expected deliverables of type Document that isn't relevant for other deliverable types.

table.name: deliverable_project_due_dates
table.remarks: Deliverable due dates overrides for projects.

table.name: deliverable_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Types of deliverables for an accelerator module.

table.name: deliverable_variables
table.remarks: Which variables are associated with which deliverables. Note that this includes variables that have been replaced by newer versions, and the newer versions might be associated with different deliverables.

table.name: deliverables
table.remarks: Information about expected deliverables. This describes what we request from users; the data we get back from users in response is recorded in `project_deliverables` and its child tables.

column.name: position
column.remarks: Which position this deliverable appears in the module's list of deliverables, starting with 1.

column.name: is_sensitive
column.remarks: If true, the data users provide in response to this deliverable will be visible to a smaller subset of accelerator admins. Secure documents are saved to a different document store than non-secure ones.

table.name: document_stores
table.remarks: (Enum) Locations where uploaded documents are stored.

table.name: event_projects
table.remarks: Projects that are participants of an event.

table.name: event_statuses
table.remarks: (Enum) Statuses of events for an accelerator module

table.name: event_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Types of events for an accelerator module

table.name: events
table.remarks: Events with meeting links and time within an acclerator module.

table.name: hubspot_token
table.remarks: If the server has been authorized to make HubSpot API requests, the refresh token to use to generate new access tokens.

table.name: internal_interests
table.remarks: (Enum) Types of notification categories for internal users.

table.name: metric_components
table.remarks: (Enum) Components of metrics for reports.

table.name: metric_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Types of metrics for reports.

table.name: modules
table.remarks: Possible steps in the workflow of a cohort phase.

column.name: position
column.remarks: This model's ordinal position in the modules spreadsheet. This can be used to present modules in the same order they appear in the spreadsheet.

table.name: participant_project_species
table.remarks: Species that are associated to a participant project

table.name: participants
table.remarks: Accelerator participant details.

table.name: pipelines
table.remarks: (Enum) Deal pipelines for accelerator projects.

table.name: project_accelerator_details
table.remarks: Details about projects that are only relevant for accelerator applicants. The values here are for internal use, not exposed to end users.

column.name: file_naming
column.remarks: Identifier that is included in generated filenames. This is often, but not necessarily, the same as the project name.

column.name: logframe_url
column.remarks: Link to the project logical framework, monitoring and evaluation plan, and operational work plan.

table.name: project_metrics
table.remarks: Metrics specific to one project to report on.

table.name: project_overall_scores
table.remarks: Overall scores assigned to project by scorers.

table.name: project_report_configs
table.remarks: Configurations for accelerator project reports, including reporting dates and reporting frequencies.

table.name: project_scores
table.remarks: Scores assigned to project by scorers.

column.name: score
column.remarks: Integer score between -2 to 2. The score can be null to represent not yet scored.

table.name: project_vote_decisions
table.remarks: Calculated vote decisions for project.

table.name: project_votes
table.remarks: Vote selected by voters.

column.name: vote_option_id
column.remarks: Vote option can be Yes/No/Conditional. The vote can be null to represent not yet voted.

table.name: report_achievements
table.remarks: List of achievements for accelerator project reports.

table.name: report_challenges
table.remarks: List of challenges and mitigation plans for accelerator project reports.

table.name: report_frequencies
table.remarks: (Enum) Frequencies of accelerator project reports. Acts as the report type as well.

table.name: report_metric_statuses
table.remarks: (Enum) Statuses of accelerator project report metrics.

table.name: report_project_metrics
table.remarks: Report entries of targets and values for project metrics.

table.name: report_quarters
table.remarks: (Enum) Quarters of accelerator project reports.

table.name: report_standard_metrics
table.remarks: Report entries of targets and values for standard metrics.

table.name: report_statuses
table.remarks: (Enum) Statuses of accelerator project reports.

table.name: report_system_metrics
table.remarks: Report entries of targets and values for system metrics.

column.name: system_value
column.remarks: Value collected via Terraware data. Null before value is submitted.

column.name: system_time
column.remarks: System value recorded time. If null, the value is not recorded yet and a live query of Terraware data should be used instead.

column.name: override_value
column.remarks: Value inputted by accelerator admin to override system value. Null for no overrides.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((system_value IS NULL) AND (system_time IS NULL)) OR ((system_value IS NOT NULL) AND (system_time IS NOT NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: system_time

table.name: reports
table.remarks: Accelerator project reports.

column.name: report_frequency_id
column.remarks: Frequency of the report, that can determine report data. Must match with frequency of the configuration.

column.name: report_quarter_id
column.remarks: Quarter of the report. Must be non-null for quarterly reports and null otherwise.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((report_frequency_id = 1) AND (report_quarter_id IS NOT NULL) AND ((report_quarter_id)::numeric = EXTRACT(quarter FROM start_date)) AND ((report_quarter_id)::numeric = EXTRACT(quarter FROM end_date))) OR ((report_frequency_id <> 1) AND (report_quarter_id IS NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: quarterly_report_has_quarter

checkConstraint.constraint: (((status_id = 1) AND (submitted_by IS NULL) AND (submitted_time IS NULL)) OR (((status_id = 2) OR (status_id = 3) OR (status_id = 4)) AND (submitted_by IS NOT NULL) AND (submitted_time IS NOT NULL)) OR (status_id = 5))
checkConstraint.name: submitted_status

table.name: score_categories
table.remarks: (Enum) Project score categories.

table.name: standard_metrics
table.remarks: Standard non-system metrics for every project to measure in accelerator reports.

table.name: submission_documents
table.remarks: Information about documents uploaded by users to satisfy deliverables. A deliverable can have multiple documents.

column.name: name
column.remarks: System-generated filename. The file is stored using this name in the document store. This includes several elements such as the date and description.

column.name: location
column.remarks: Location of file in the document store identified by `document_store_id`. This is used by the system to generate download links and includes whatever information is needed to generate a link for a given document store; if the document store supports permalinks then this may be a simple URL.

column.name: original_name
column.remarks: Original filename as supplied by the client when the document was uploaded. Not required to be unique since the user can upload revised versions of documents.

table.name: submission_snapshots
table.remarks: Snapshot files associated to submissions

table.name: submission_statuses
table.remarks: (Enum) Statuses of submissions of deliverables by specific projects.

table.name: submissions
table.remarks: Information about the current states of the information supplied by specific projects in response to deliverables.

table.name: system_metrics
table.remarks: (Enum) Accelerator report metrics, for which data are collected from Terraware.

table.name: user_internal_interests
table.remarks: Which internal interest categories are assigned to which internal users. This affects things like which accelerator admins are notified.

table.name: vote_options
table.remarks: (Enum) Available vote options.
